conclusion: Understand the geometry of the wire bent into a ν shape with equal side lengths and an included angle of 60°.
Each side of the ν shape is of length l.
Calculate the effective length of the wire in the direction of the magnetic field.
For each side of length l, the perpendicular component is l sin(60°) = l * √3/2.
The total effective length Leff is l√3.
Apply the Ampere force formula: F = B I Leff.
Substitute Leff = l√3 into the formula: F = B I (l√3).
Simplify the expression to F = B I l√3.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the ν-shaped current-carrying wire is F = B I l√3.
